cards.name: Sabertooth Cobra
cards.text: Whenever Sabertooth Cobra deals damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter. The player gets another poison counter at the beginning of their next upkeep unless they pay {2} before that step. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

rulings.text: The ability still gives a poison counter even if Sabertooth Cobra leaves the battlefield before the next upkeep.

cards.originalText: If Sabertooth Cobra damages a player, he or she gets a poison counter. During that player's next upkeep, he or she gets another poison counter unless he or she pays {2} before then to prevent this effect. If any player has ten or more poison counters, he or she loses the game.

cards.name: Sandstorm
cards.text: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
cards.flavor:
Better to fight the sand for a few hours than to sleep beneath it forever.
—Suq'Ata truism
cards.originalText: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

cards.name: Seedling Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Return target Aura attached to a creature to its owner's hand.
• Regenerate target green creature.
• Target creature gains trample until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one Return target creature enchantment to owner's hand; or regenerate target green creature; or target creature gains trample until end of turn.

cards.name: Seeds of Innocence
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated. The controller of each of those artifacts gains life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"I have hidden from the machinations of Zhalfir for centuries. Why should I join your campaign?"
—Jolrael
cards.originalText: Bury all artifacts. Each artifact's controller gains an amount of life equal to that artifact's casting cost.

cards.name: Serene Heart
cards.text: Destroy all Auras.
cards.flavor:
"If magic is your crutch, cast it aside and learn to walk without it."
—Teferi
cards.originalText: Destroy all local enchantments.

cards.name: Stalking Tiger
cards.text: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: In the Jamuraan jungles, there is often no separating beauty from danger.
cards.originalText: Stalking Tiger cannot be blocked by more than one creature.

cards.name: Superior Numbers
cards.text: Superior Numbers deals damage to target creature equal to the number of creatures you control in excess of the number of creatures target opponent controls.

rulings.text: As you cast this, you target a creature and an opponent. The opponent does not have to be that creature's controller.

If the creature becomes an illegal target before the spell resolves (but the opponent doesn't), the spell will be unable to affect that creature. Although the spell will still resolve, it won't deal any damage.

cards.originalText: Superior Numbers deals to target creature 1 damage for each creature you control in excess of the number of creatures target opponent controls.

cards.name: Tranquil Domain
cards.text: Destroy all non-Aura enchantments.
cards.flavor:
"An ancient court mage unified the houses into guilds to serve Zhalfir above their own interests. Even during the civil war, the guilds stood together, a testament to the wisdom of Teferi."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText: Destroy all global enchantments.

cards.name: Tropical Storm
cards.text: Tropical Storm deals X damage to each creature with flying and 1 additional damage to each blue creature.
cards.flavor:
"After the storm, I found a sea turtle dying on the sands, a blade of grass driven through its shell."
—Travelogue of Najat
cards.originalText: Tropical Storm deals X damage to each creature with flying and 1 damage to each blue creature.

cards.name: Uktabi Faerie
cards.text:
Flying
{3}{G}, Sacrifice Uktabi Faerie: Destroy target artifact.
cards.flavor:
Victim of the two-toed faerie
—Suq'Ata expression meaning "broken"
cards.originalText:
Flying
{3}{G}, Sacrifice Uktabi Faerie: Destroy target artifact.

cards.name: Uktabi Wildcats
cards.text:
Uktabi Wildcats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control.
{G}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate Uktabi Wildcats.
cards.originalText:
Uktabi Wildcats has power and toughness each equal to the number of forests you control.
{G}, Sacrifice a forest: Regenerate

cards.name: Unseen Walker
cards.text:
Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)
{1}{G}{G}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"To pass through the jungle: silence, courtesy, ferocity, as the occasion demands."
—Kamau, "Proper Passage"
cards.originalText:
Forestwalk (If defending player controls any forests, this creature is unblockable.)
{1}{G}{G}: Target creature gains forestwalk until end of turn.

cards.name: Unyaro Bee Sting
cards.text: Unyaro Bee Sting deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"Much can be learned from the bees about dying for a cause."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger
cards.originalText: Unyaro Bee Sting deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Village Elder
cards.text: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice a Forest: Regenerate target creature.
cards.flavor:
"Enchant me with your tale-telling. Tell about Tree, Grass, River, and Wind. / Tell why Truth must fight with Falsehood, and why Truth will always win."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.originalText: {G}, {T}, Sacrifice a forest: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Waiting in the Weeds
cards.text: Each player creates a 1/1 green Cat creature token for each untapped Forest they control.
cards.flavor: The trees have ears, eyes, and teeth.
cards.originalText: For each untapped forest he or she controls, each player puts a Cat token into play under his or her control. Treat these tokens as 1/1 green creatures.

cards.name: Wall of Roots
cards.text:
Defender
Put a -0/-1 counter on Wall of Roots: Add {G}. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: Sometimes the wise ones wove their magic into living plants; as the plant grew, so grew the magic.

rulings.text: If you must sacrifice a creature to pay a casting or activation cost that also includes mana, such as that of Bubbling Cauldron's abilities, you may put a -0/-1 counter on Wall of Roots to make its toughness 0 and then sacrifice it to pay that cost.

cards.originalText: Put a -0/-1 counter on Wall of Roots: Add {G} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source. Use this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Wild Elephant
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor:
"I will tell my father's stories . . . . How the elephants trampled the leopard cub, and its father, though he knew, killed nine goats instead."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Worldly Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
cards.flavor:
"Aselbo soon had the rhino eating from his palm and the snake waiting at his heels."
—Afari, Tales

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a creature card and reveal that card to all players. Shuffle your library and put the revealed card back on top of it.

cards.name: Agility
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has flanking. (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)

rulings.text: If the enchanted creature already has Flanking, its effect is cumulative.

cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and gains flanking (whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn).

cards.name: Aleatory
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during combat after blockers are declared.
Flip a coin. If you win the flip, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: You pick the target on announcement and flip the coin on resolution.
If a turn has multiple combat phases, this spell can be cast during any of them as long as it's after the beginning of that phase's Declare Blockers Step.

cards.originalText:
Play only after defense is chosen.
Flip a coin; target opponent calls heads or tails while coin is in the air. If the flip ends up in your favor, target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Armorer Guildmage
cards.text:
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
Zhalfir's destiny rings in tempered steel.
—Armorer Guild maxim
cards.originalText:
{B}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Barreling Attack
cards.text: Target creature gains trample until end of turn. When that creature becomes blocked this turn, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature blocking it.
cards.flavor:
"The trollish game of push-fall inspired this impressive tactic."
—Sidar Jabari

rulings.text: Both the +1/+1 and trample last only until end of turn.

Upon resolution, this gives the targeted creature trample and creates a delayed-triggered ability that will trigger when the creature becomes blocked. The creature will get +1/+1 for each creature blocking it as that ability resolves. This means that if Barreling Attack is cast after blockers are declared, the targeted creature will gain trample but won't be able to get +1/+1 because it's too late for the ability to trigger (unless there is another combat phase in the turn).

cards.originalText: Target creature gains trample until end of turn. That creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each creature that blocks it.

cards.name: Blind Fury
cards.text: All creatures lose trample until end of turn. If a creature would deal combat damage to a creature this turn, it deals double that damage to that creature instead.
cards.flavor:
"Tell me . . . have you ever sung the Song of Blood?"
—Purraj of Urborg
cards.originalText: All creatures lose trample until end of turn. Double all combat damage assigned to creatures this turn.

cards.name: Blistering Barrier
cards.text: Defender (This creature can't attack.)
cards.flavor:
I live without food, stand without leg, wound without force, and am harder to fight than to kill. What am I?
—Femeref riddle

cards.name: Builder's Bane
cards.text: Destroy X target artifacts. Builder's Bane deals damage to each player equal to the number of artifacts they controlled that were put into a graveyard this way.
cards.flavor: There is only so much a person may be buried with.
cards.originalText: Destroy X target artifacts. For each artifact put into the graveyard in this way, Builder's Bane deals 1 damage to that artifact's controller.

cards.name: Burning Palm Efreet
cards.text: {1}{R}{R}: Burning Palm Efreet deals 2 damage to target creature with flying and that creature loses flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Even the lion envies the lark.
cards.originalText: {1}{R}{R}: Burning Palm Efreet deals 2 damage to target creature with flying and that creature loses flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Burning Shield Askari
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{R}{R}: Burning Shield Askari gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Any day that I ride my horse up to my ankles in the remains of my enemies is a good day."
—Akin, seasoned askari
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{R}{R}: First strike until end of turn

cards.name: Chaos Charm
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target Wall.
• Chaos Charm deals 1 damage to target creature.
• Target creature gains haste until end of turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one Target creature is unaffected by summoning sickness this turn; or Chaos Charm deals 1 damage to target creature; or destroy target Wall.

cards.name: Chaosphere
cards.text:
Creatures with flying can block only creatures with flying.
Creatures without flying have reach. (They can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"I dance the nothing dance, / Feet in the air, knives in the ground."
—Femeref chant

rulings.text: This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.

cards.originalText:
Creatures with flying cannot block creatures without flying.
Creatures without flying can block creatures with flying.

cards.name: Cinder Cloud
cards.text: Destroy target creature. If a white creature dies this way, Cinder Cloud deals damage to that creature's controller equal to the creature's power.
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. If a white creature is put into the graveyard in this way, Cinder Cloud deals to that creature's controller an amount of damage equal to the creature's power.

cards.name: Consuming Ferocity
cards.text:
Enchant non-Wall creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0.
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a +1/+0 counter on enchanted creature. If that creature has three or more +1/+0 counters on it, it deals damage equal to its power to its controller, then destroy that creature and it can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText:
Play only on a non-Wall creature.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0.
During your upkeep, put a +1/+0 counter on enchanted creature. At the end of any upkeep, if that creature has three of these counters on it, bury the creature and it deals to its controller an amount of damage equal to its power.

cards.name: Crimson Hellkite
cards.text:
Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana on X.
cards.flavor:
"Dragonfire forged me a warrior."
—Rashida Scalebane
cards.originalText:
Flying
{X}, {T}: Crimson Hellkite deals X damage to target creature. Spend only red mana in this way.

cards.name: Crimson Roc
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Crimson Roc blocks a creature without flying, Crimson Roc gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.originalText:
Flying
If Crimson Roc blocks any creature without flying, Crimson Roc gets +1/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Dwarven Miner
cards.text: {2}{R}, {T}: Destroy target nonbasic land.
cards.flavor:
"Fetch the pestridder, Paka—we've got dwarves in the rutabagas!"
—Jamul, Femeref farmer
cards.originalText: {2}{R}, {T}: Destroy target nonbasic land.

cards.name: Dwarven Nomad
cards.text: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.
cards.flavor:
A dwarf's life belongs as much to the land as to the dwarf.
—Creed of the Stonethrow Clan
cards.originalText: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less is unblockable this turn.

cards.name: Ekundu Cyclops
cards.text: If a creature you control attacks, Ekundu Cyclops also attacks if able.
cards.flavor:
"Big one I,
One big eye.
One-eye see
Two-eye die!"
—Traditional cyclops chant
cards.originalText: If any creature you control attacks, Ekundu Cyclops also attacks if able.

cards.name: Emberwilde Djinn
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may pay {R}{R} or 2 life. If the player does, they gain control of Emberwilde Djinn.
cards.flavor: A hefty price is no guarantee of quality merchandise.
cards.originalText:
Flying
During each player's upkeep, he or she may pay {R}{R} or 2 life to gain control of Emberwilde Djinn.

cards.name: Final Fortune
cards.text: Take an extra turn after this one. At the beginning of that turn's end step, you lose the game.
cards.flavor:
Want all, lose all.
—Zhalfirin aphorism

rulings.text: If you end up skipping the extra turn that is gained, you do not lose the game.
If multiple "extra turn" effects resolve in the same turn, take them in the reverse of the order that the effects resolved.

cards.originalText: Take another turn after this one. You lose the game at the end of that turn.

cards.name: Firebreathing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Magic's only part of it, my friend. Diet does the rest."
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

rulings.text: This ability can be activated by Firebreathing's controller, not the enchanted creature's controller (in case they're different players).
The ability affects whichever creature is enchanted by Firebreathing at the time the ability resolves. The bonus remains even if Firebreathing stops enchanting that creature.

cards.originalText: {R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Flame Elemental
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice Flame Elemental: It deals damage equal to its power to target creature.
cards.flavor:
Storyteller: By my hand in the fire, this story is a tale of power.
Listeners: May it give you strength.
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice Flame Elemental: Flame Elemental deals an amount of damage equal to its power to target creature.

cards.name: Flare
cards.text:
Flare deals 1 damage to any target.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"In the forest, fires light the sky as black clouds unfold their weight."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.originalText:
Flare deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Goblin Elite Infantry
cards.text: Whenever Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or becomes blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: They talk a good fight.
cards.originalText: If Goblin Elite Infantry blocks or is blocked, it gets -1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Scouts
cards.text: Create three 1/1 red Goblin Scout creature tokens with mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)
cards.flavor:
"Pathetic—like I wouldn't know a goblin painted up to look like a dwarf!"
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader

rulings.text: The tokens are of creature type Goblin and Scout. They are affected by things that affect Goblins.
The tokens have 'Mountainwalk' in their text, and will be affected by text-changing effects accordingly.

cards.originalText: Put three Goblin Scout tokens into play. Treat these tokens as 1/1 red creatures with mountainwalk that count as Goblins (if defending player controls any mountains, these creatures are unblockable).

cards.name: Goblin Soothsayer
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Red creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I see a great victory and rivers of blood. And . . . hmm, looks like a spleen."
—Grishnak, goblin soothsayer
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a Goblin: All red creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Goblin Tinkerer
cards.text: {R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. That artifact deals damage equal to its converted mana cost to Goblin Tinkerer.
cards.flavor:
"Can they do that?"
—Imwita, Zhalfirin artificer, last words
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}: Destroy target artifact. That artifact deals an amount of damage equal to its casting cost to Goblin Tinkerer.

cards.name: Hammer of Bogardan
cards.text:
Hammer of Bogardan deals 3 damage to any target.
{2}{R}{R}{R}: Return Hammer of Bogardan from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.originalText:
Hammer of Bogardan deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
{2}{R}{R}{R}: Return Hammer of Bogardan to your hand. Use this ability only during your upkeep and only if Hammer of Bogardan is in your graveyard.

cards.name: Hivis of the Scale
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Hivis of the Scale during your untap step.
{T}: Gain control of target Dragon for as long as you control Hivis and Hivis remains tapped.
cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Hivis of the Scale during your untap phase.
{T}: Gain control of target Dragon. If Hivis becomes untapped or you lose control of Hivis, lose control of that Dragon.

cards.name: Illicit Auction
cards.text: Each player may bid life for control of target creature. You start the bidding with a bid of 0. In turn order, each player may top the high bid. The bidding ends if the high bid stands. The high bidder loses life equal to the high bid and gains control of the creature. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

rulings.text: This is a life loss and not a life payment so you can bid more life than you have.

cards.originalText: Choose target creature. Each player may bid life for control of that creature. You begin the bidding with a high bid of 0. Proceeding in turn order, each player may top the high bid. The auction ends when the high bid stands. The high bidder loses an amount of life equal to the high bid and gains control of the creature.

cards.name: Incinerate
cards.text: Incinerate deals 3 damage to any target. A creature dealt damage this way can't be regenerated this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Never taunt an embermage, 'What are you going to do about it?'"
—Akin, seasoned askari

rulings.text: Regeneration abilities that would affect that creature can still be activated; they just won't do anything. The creature can't be regenerated for any reason, even if an effect other than Incinerate would deal lethal damage to it or otherwise destroy it.

cards.originalText: Incinerate deals 3 damage to target creature or player. A creature damaged by Incinerate cannot regenerate this turn.

cards.name: Kaervek's Torch
cards.text:
As long as Kaervek's Torch is on the stack, spells that target it cost {2} more to cast.
Kaervek's Torch deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
The pulsing heat of the midday Sun burns in the Lion's eye.
—Stone inscription, source unknown
cards.originalText:
Interrupts that target Kaervek's Torch each cost an additional {2} to play.
Kaervek's Torch deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Lightning Reflexes
cards.text:
You may cast Lightning Reflexes as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has first strike.
cards.flavor: "Inhale. Kill. Exhale."

rulings.text: The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
You may choose to play Lightning Reflexes as an instant; if you do, bury it at end of turn.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and gains first strike.

cards.name: Pyric Salamander
cards.text: {R}: Pyric Salamander gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Sacrifice Pyric Salamander at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor:
When you've been chased by a dragon, you run from every lizard.
—Suq'Ata saying
cards.originalText: {R}: +1/+0 until end of turn. Bury Pyric Salamander at end of turn.

cards.name: Raging Spirit
cards.text: {2}: Raging Spirit becomes colorless until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Its burning power is more elusive than shade on the Unyaro Plains, more perilous than the horn of a rhino."
—Akin, seasoned askari
cards.originalText: {2}: Raging Spirit is colorless until end of turn.

cards.name: Reckless Embermage
cards.text: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to any target and 1 damage to itself.
cards.flavor: Many mages have been consumed by their work.
cards.originalText: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to itself.

cards.name: Reign of Chaos
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target Plains and target white creature.
• Destroy target Island and target blue creature.
cards.flavor:
"The Burning Isles are the home to a dozen lords who claim dominion. Jamuraa will look to only one leader: me."
—Kaervek
cards.originalText: Destroy target plains and target white creature, or destroy target island and target blue creature.

cards.name: Searing Spear Askari
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{R}: Searing Spear Askari gains menace until end of turn. (It can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
cards.flavor: When the other soldiers of Zhalfir fall, the askaris will yet stand.

rulings.text: The ability only does something if used before blockers are declared. You can use it afterwards but to no useful effect.

cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{R}: Searing Spear Askari cannot be blocked by only one creature this turn.

cards.name: Sirocco
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. For each blue instant card revealed this way, that player discards that card unless they pay 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"Blow, fiery wind, / strip illusion from the eye. / Blow, fiery wind of truth."
—Femeref chant

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText: Target player reveals his or her hand to all players. For each blue interrupt card that player holds, he or she pays 4 life or discards that card.

cards.name: Spitting Earth
cards.text: Spitting Earth deals damage to target creature equal to the number of Mountains you control.
cards.flavor:
"There are times solid ground gives precious little comfort."
—Talibah, embermage
cards.originalText: Spitting Earth deals to target creature an amount of damage equal to the number of mountains you control.

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.
cards.flavor:
"What rainbow could possibly come of this rain?"
—Asmira, Holy Avenger
cards.originalText: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Subterranean Spirit
cards.text:
Protection from red
{T}: Subterranean Spirit deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.
cards.flavor:
"Air hot with sulfur. / Earth heaves beneath me. / Could it be the mountain / ate something bad?"
—Dwarven mining song
cards.originalText:
Protection from red
{T}: Subterranean Spirit deals 1 damage to each creature without flying.

cards.name: Talruum Minotaur
cards.text: Haste
cards.flavor:
Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift.
—Suq'Ata saying
cards.originalText: Talruum Minotaur is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Telim'Tor
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Telim'Tor attacks, all attacking creatures with flanking get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The curious merely amass knowledge. The ambitious use it."
—Telim'Tor
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
If Telim'Tor attacks, all attacking creatures with flanking get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Telim'Tor's Edict
cards.text:
Exile target permanent you own or control.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Execution awaits the dissenter."
—Kasib ibn Naji, Letters
cards.originalText:
Remove from the game target permanent you own or control.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Torrent of Lava
cards.text:
Torrent of Lava deals X damage to each creature without flying.
As long as Torrent of Lava is on the stack, each creature has "{T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to this creature by Torrent of Lava this turn."
cards.flavor: The mountain's voice shouts us all down.

rulings.text: If X is zero, it deals no damage (not -1 damage) to non-flying creatures it taps.
It grants the activated ability to creatures while on the stack. This allows the ability to be activated and resolved before the Torrent itself resolves.

cards.originalText:
Torrent of Lava deals X damage to each creature without flying.
Each creature gains "{T}: Prevent 1 damage to this creature from Torrent of Lava."

cards.name: Viashino Warrior
cards.flavor:
"When traveling the Great Desert avoid wearing the scales of lizards, for the Viashino rule the sands and look poorly on the skinning of their cousins."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

cards.name: Volcanic Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: Speed and fire are always a deadly combination.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Volcanic Dragon is unaffected by summoning sickness.

cards.name: Volcanic Geyser
cards.text: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
My thunder comes before the lightning; my lightning comes before the clouds; my rain dries all the land it touches. What am I?
—Femeref riddle
cards.originalText: Volcanic Geyser deals X damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Wildfire Emissary
cards.text:
Protection from white
{1}{R}: Wildfire Emissary gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The efreet is a striding storm with a voice that crackles like fire."
—Qhattib, Vizier of Amiqat
cards.originalText:
Protection from white 
{1}{R}: +1/+0 until end of turn

cards.name: Zirilan of the Claw
cards.text: {1}{R}{R}, {T}: Search your library for a Dragon permanent card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library. That Dragon gains haste until end of turn. Exile it at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

If the Dragon is put onto the battlefield and then phases out, the "exile it" ability will still apply. It will trigger at the beginning of the next End step and exile the Dragon if it has phased back in. If the Dragon is still phased out, then it cannot be exiled so ability won't do anything.

cards.originalText: {1}{R}{R}, {T}: Search your library for a Dragon card and put it into play as though it were just played. Shuffle your library afterwards. That creature is unaffected by summoning sickness. Remove the creature from the game at end of any turn.

cards.name: Afterlife
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller creates a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: Facets of life, reflections of the soul.
cards.originalText: Bury target creature and put an Essence token into play under the control of that creature's controller. Treat this token as a 1/1 white creature with flying.

cards.name: Alarum
cards.text: Untap target nonattacking creature. It gets +1/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"One timely cry of warning can save nine of surprise."
—Sidar Jabari
cards.originalText: Untap target nonattacking creature. That creature gets +1/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Auspicious Ancestor
cards.text:
When Auspicious Ancestor dies, you gain 3 life.
Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText:
If Auspicious Ancestor is put into the graveyard from play, gain 3 life.
{1}: Gain 1 life. Use this ability only when a white spell is successfully cast and only once for each such spell.

cards.name: Benevolent Unicorn
cards.text: If a spell would deal damage to a permanent or player, it deals that much damage minus 1 to that permanent or player instead.
cards.flavor:
The best use for a unicorn's horn is to adorn a unicorn.
—Femeref adage
cards.originalText: Whenever a spell assigns damage to a creature or player, that damage is reduced by 1.

cards.name: Blinding Light
cards.text: Tap all nonwhite creatures.
cards.flavor:
"My shield will bear a shining sun so you will always be with me. / Inlaid with gold, it will shine like glowing embers."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"

rulings.text: Will not tap a creature that is both white and another color.

cards.originalText: Tap all nonwhite creatures.

cards.name: Celestial Dawn
cards.text:
Lands you control are Plains.
Nonland permanents you control are white. The same is true for spells you control and nonland cards you own that aren't on the battlefield.
You may spend white mana as though it were mana of any color. You may spend other mana only as though it were colorless mana.

rulings.text: The effect to turn all your non-land cards (including artifacts) white is the effect of a static ability. Thus, a color change on a permanent prior to Celestial Dawn entering the battlefield will be overridden by Celestial Dawn's effect.
Celestial Dawn does not change the type of lands which are not on the battlefield. Lands not on the battlefield are what they say they are.
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype from a land.

You may use a different color mana than the color required for spells and abilities that require a specific color. If you do, and the spell or ability checks the actual color of the mana, it can tell the difference.

If you pay white mana to activate an ability that can only be activated by spending another color of mana, then any limitations on activating the ability (such as the number of times it can be activated each turn) still apply as if you spent the proper color.
Celestial Dawn no longer changes mana symbols on cards.

Mana produced by spells you control and nonland permanents you control isn't affected by Celestial Dawn. Llanowar Elves will produce {G}, for example. However, any colored mana may be spent only on the colorless part of costs.
Land cards you own that aren't on the battlefield aren't changed to Plains.
If you have nonwhite mana in your mana pool when Celestial Dawn enters the battlefield, it remains there but you can spend it only on the colorless part of costs.

If you use a text-changing effect such as Mind Bend on Celestial Dawn to change the word "Plains" to a different land type, your lands are all of that new land type, and they will produce mana of the appropriate color for that type.
If a permanent enters the battlefield while Celestial Dawn is on the battlefield, and then Celestial Dawn leaves the battlefield, the permanent's color will revert to the colors in its mana cost.

If a nonbasic land has an ability that causes it to enter the battlefield tapped, it will lose that ability before it applies. The same is also true of any other abilities that modify how a land enters the battlefield or apply "as" a land enters the battlefield, such as the first ability of Cavern of Souls. This is a change from previous rulings.

cards.originalText: All nonland cards you own that are not in play are white. All nonland permanents you control are white. All lands you control are plains. All colored mana symbols in all costs on all of these cards and permanents are {W}.

cards.name: Civic Guildmage
cards.text:
{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{U}, {T}: Put target creature you control on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
To condemn the innocent you must first condemn yourself.
—Civic Guild maxim
cards.originalText:
{G}, {T}: Target creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
{U}, {T}: Put target creature you control on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Dazzling Beauty
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during the declare blockers step.
Target unblocked attacking creature becomes blocked. (This spell works on creatures that can't be blocked.)
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

rulings.text: Is not very useful against Trample creatures since Trample damage comes through as if a zero toughness creature blocked the Trampler.
Works on creatures that can't be blocked and on creatures that have special blocking requirements.

cards.originalText:
Play only when defense is chosen.
Target unblocked creature is considered blocked.
Draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

cards.name: Disempower
cards.text: Put target artifact or enchantment on top of its owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"Mangara is gone. Who among you doubts that I have taken his power?"
—Kaervek
cards.originalText: Put target artifact or enchantment on top of owner's library.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"There are harsher ways to learn the meaning of the word 'no.'"
—Rashida Scalebane

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Divine Offering
cards.text: Destroy target artifact. You gain life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"Suq'Ata believe in trade; Femeref, alms; Zhalfirins, steel. Be warned, Kaervek—now we are joined."
—Sidar Jabari

rulings.text: If the target artifact becomes illegal before resolution, you do not gain any life.
If Divine Offering resolves, but the artifact regenerates or has indestructible, you'll still gain the life.

cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact. Gain an amount of life equal to that artifact's casting cost.

cards.name: Divine Retribution
cards.text: Divine Retribution deals damage to target attacking creature equal to the number of attacking creatures.
cards.flavor:
"To the undiscerning eye, justice and vengeance can look the same."
—Rashida Scalebane
cards.originalText: For each attacking creature, Divine Retribution deals 1 damage to target attacking creature.

cards.name: Ekundu Griffin
cards.text: Flying, first strike
cards.flavor:
"My goat was a small price to pay for the chance to see the hunting griffin dive and seize it."
—Pashad ibn Asim, Suq'Ata trader
cards.originalText: Flying, first strike

cards.name: Enlightened Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for an artifact or enchantment card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
cards.flavor:
"I do not teach. I simply reveal."
—Daudi, Femeref tutor

rulings.text: The "shuffle and put the card on top" is a single action. If an effect causes the top card of the library to be face up, the second card down is not revealed.

cards.originalText: Search your library for an artifact or enchantment card and reveal that card to all players. Shuffle your library and put the revealed card back on top of it.

cards.name: Ethereal Champion
cards.text: Pay 1 life: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ethereal Champion this turn.
cards.flavor:
"If I have learned anything as a wizard it is this: never fight your own battles."
—Waffa, sorcerer of Nyomba
cards.originalText: Pay 1 life: Prevent 1 damage to Ethereal Champion.

cards.name: Favorable Destiny
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2 as long as it's white.
Enchanted creature has shroud as long as its controller controls another creature. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
cards.originalText:
As long as enchanted creature's controller controls at least one other creature, enchanted creature cannot be the target of spells or effects.
As long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+2.

cards.name: Femeref Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Faith is my shield, and hope is my armor; I am vulnerable only to myself."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger
cards.originalText: {T}: Prevent 1 damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Femeref Knight
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{W}: Femeref Knight gains vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "I will return / with lizard skins for your sandals. Paint your eyes black and wait for me." —"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{W}: Attacking does not cause Femeref Knight to tap this turn.

cards.name: Femeref Scouts
cards.flavor:
"The days before the war were filled with strange portents: scouts and herders spoke of villages reduced to ash, of farmers taken from their fields, and of foul beasts roaming the plains in packs. I know, for I spoke to them all."
—Hakim, Loreweaver

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor:
"The Femeref look only to the Sun for healing; they have never truly understood life's cycle."
—Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage
cards.originalText: Target player gains 3 life, or prevent up to 3 damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Illumination
cards.text: Counter target artifact or enchantment spell. Its controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.flavor:
"A brilliant light can either illuminate or blind. How will you know which until you open your eyes?"
—Asmira, Holy Avenger
cards.originalText: Counter target artifact or enchantment spell. That spell's caster gains an amount of life equal to the spell's casting cost.

cards.name: Iron Tusk Elephant
cards.text: Trample
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.text:
Choose one —
• All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn.
• Tap target creature.
• Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.originalText: Choose one All creatures get -2/-0 until end of turn; or prevent 1 damage to any creature or player; or tap target creature.

cards.name: Jabari's Influence
cards.text:
Cast this spell only after combat.
Gain control of target nonartifact, nonblack creature that attacked you this turn and put a -1/-0 counter on it.
cards.flavor:
"Common soldiers can't understand what a sidar knows: the enemy can be a resource."
—Sidar Jabari
cards.originalText:
Play only after combat.
Gain control of target nonartifact, nonblack creature that attacked you this turn and put a -1/-0 counter on it.

cards.name: Mangara's Blessing
cards.text:
You gain 5 life.
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Mangara's Blessing, you gain 2 life, and you return Mangara's Blessing from your graveyard to your hand at the beginning of the next end step.

rulings.text: The 2 life from having it discarded is gained when the triggered ability resolves, not at end of turn. Only the return to hand is done at end of turn.
The Mangara's Blessing card is only returned if it is still in the graveyard at end of turn and never left the graveyard in the meantime.

cards.originalText:
Gain 5 life. 
When a spell or ability an opponent controls causes you to discard Mangara's Blessing, you gain 2 life and return Mangara's Blessing from your graveyard to your hand at end of turn.

cards.name: Mangara's Equity
cards.text:
As Mangara's Equity enters the battlefield, choose black or red.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Mangara's Equity unless you pay {1}{W}.
Whenever a creature of the chosen color deals damage to you or a white creature you control, Mangara's Equity deals that much damage to that creature.
cards.originalText:
When you play Mangara's Equity, choose black or red.
During your upkeep, pay {1}{W} or bury Mangara's Equity.
For each 1 damage a creature of the chosen color deals to you or a white creature you control, Mangara's Equity deals 1 damage to that creature.

cards.name: Melesse Spirit
cards.text: Flying, protection from black
cards.flavor: Like a laughing knife, immaculate and sharp, is the Melesse.
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from black

cards.name: Mtenda Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
{W}, {T}: Return Mtenda Griffin to its owner's hand and return target Griffin card from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.flavor: "Unlike Zhalfir, the griffin needs no council to keep harmony among its parts." —Asmira, Holy Avenger

rulings.text: Must have a Griffin in the graveyard to use this ability because it requires a target.

cards.originalText:
Flying
{W}, {T}: Return Mtenda Griffin to owner's hand and return target Griffin card in your graveyard to your hand. Use this ability only during your upkeep.

cards.name: Mtenda Herder
cards.text: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
cards.flavor:
"All animals—even humans—can be herded. The trick is to make them think they choose their own destination."
—Mangara
cards.originalText: Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)

cards.name: Noble Elephant
cards.text: Trample; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor:
"Proud am I, / strong am I, / courageous in defending my children / and fierce in punishing what stands in my way."
—"So the Elephant Speaks,"
Zhalfirin song

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding, trample

cards.name: Null Chamber
cards.text:
As Null Chamber enters the battlefield, you and an opponent each choose a card name other than a basic land card name.
Spells with the chosen names can't be cast and lands with the chosen names can't be played.
cards.flavor: Discovered by Femeref mages, the Null Chamber is the ultimate testing ground for the uncreative.

rulings.text: If you somehow manage to cast this while other spells are on the stack, those spells won't be countered.

This has the supertype world. When a world permanent enters the battlefield, any world permanents that were already on the battlefield are put into their owners' graveyards. This is a state-based action called the "world rule." The new world permanent stays on the battlefield. If two world permanents enter the battlefield at the same time, they're both put into their owners' graveyards.
You choose which opponent makes the choice. Null Chamber does not target that opponent.

cards.originalText: You and target opponent each name any card except a basic land. Those cards cannot be played.
